page.title: 03Saint Cybi's Church,Llangybi
page.content: within the 11th century Church of Saint Cybi are the wall paintings dating from around 1450,some of which have been restored to their former glory after lying hidden beneath whitewash and plaster for some 500 years."Christ of the Trades"and"The Creed"are fully restored and it is hoped to start work shortly on a painting of Saint Christopher believed to be hidden belowa text of the ten commandments.Bells are still rung on Sundays and for weddings.There are 6_8 bell ringers and eight bells.No 20th Century records here!The churchyard contains the communal grave of all five victims of the famous 19th century Llangybi murders.
